intro: Trachyandra asperata var. carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina sandwort, is a member of the Montiaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, stiff hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually white or pale blue in color. It is native to the southeastern United States and is adapted to dry, open habitats.
